018package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal;
019
020import static java.util.Objects.isNull;
021import static java.util.Objects.nonNull;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.util.Entities.HTML50;
025
026import java.io.IOException;
027import java.io.Reader;
028import java.lang.reflect.Array;
029import java.util.Collection;
030import java.util.Comparator;
031import java.util.Enumeration;
032import java.util.List;
033import java.util.Map;
034import java.util.Optional;
035import java.util.stream.Stream;
036
037import org.apiguardian.api.API;
038import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
039import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.annotation.UtilityClass;
040import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.exception.EmptyArgumentException;
041import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.exception.NullArgumentException;
042import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
043import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.util.ListBasedComparator;
044
045/**
046 *  <p>{@summary Tools and constants for the JavaDoc extension.}</p>
047 *  <p>Originally, this tool was developed with lots of dependencies to the
048 *  other <i>Foundation</i> libraries; the static stuff from
049 *  {@code foundation-base} and {@code foundation-util} was placed into this
050 *  class.</p>
051 *
052 *  @version $Id: ToolKit.java 991 2022-01-16 16:58:29Z tquadrat $
053 *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
054 *  @since 0.1.0
055 */
056@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.1.0" )
057@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ToolKit.java 991 2022-01-16 16:58:29Z tquadrat $" )
058@UtilityClass
059public class ToolKit
060{
061        /*---------------*\
062    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
063        \*---------------*/
064    /**
065     *  Implementations of this interface provides the sort order key from the
066     *  given instance of the type.
067     *
068     *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
069     *  @version $Id: ToolKit.java 991 2022-01-16 16:58:29Z tquadrat $
070     *  @since 0.0.5
071     *
072     *  @param  <T> The type to order.
073     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
074     *      be the same as the type itself.
075     */
076    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
077    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ToolKit.java 991 2022-01-16 16:58:29Z tquadrat $" )
078    @FunctionalInterface
079    public interface KeyProvider<T,K>
080    {
081            /*---------*\
082        ====** Methods **======================================================
083            \*---------*/
084        /**
085         *  Returns the sort order key for the given instance.
086         *
087         *  @param  instance    The instance; may be {@code null}.
088         *  @return The respective sort order key; will be {@code null} if
089         *      the {@code instance} was {@code null}.
090         */
091        public K getKey( T instance );
092    }
093    //  interface KeyProvider
094
095        /*-----------*\
096    ====** Constants **========================================================
097        \*-----------*/
098    /**
099     *  The lead-in for a CDATA wrapped String: {@value}
100     */
101    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
102    public static final String CDATA_LEADIN = "<![CDATA[";
103
104    /**
105     *  The lead-out for a CDATA wrapped String: {@value}
106     */
107    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
108    public static final String CDATA_LEADOUT = "]]>";
109
110    /**
111     *  <p>{@summary The hyphen character (&amp;#8208;/&amp;#x2010;/\u2010/HYPHEN).}</p>
112     *  <p>This is different from the character '&#x002D;' (HYPHEN-MINUS),
113     *  although it looks similar. This character can be used as a replacement
114     *  for the HYPHEN-MINUS in contexts where HYPHEN-MINUS has a special
115     *  meaning.</p>
116     */
117    /*
118     * For some reason, JavaDoc refuses to accept both &#8208; and &#x2010;
119     * as valid entities.
120     */
121    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
122    public static final char CHAR_HYPHEN = '\u2010';
123
124    /**
125     *  The zero-width non-breaking space character; in fact, the 'word joiner'
126     *  character that should be used instead of the original character.
127     */
128    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
129    public static final char CHAR_ZWNBSP = '\u2060';
130
131    /**
132     *  Some methods in this class need a buffer; the size of this buffer is
133     *  defined here: {@value}.
134     */
135    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
136    public static final int DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE = 8192;
137
138    /**
139     *  An empty array of
140     *  {@link String}
141     *  instances.
142     */
143    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
144    public static final String [] EMPTY_String_ARRAY = new String [0];
145
146    /**
147     *  The index value indicating that nothing was found: {@value}. See for
148     *  example
149     *  {@link String#indexOf(int)}.
150     */
151    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
152    public static final int NOT_FOUND = -1;
153
154    /**
155     *  A String containing the sequence &quot;null&quot;.
156     */
157    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
158    public static final String NULL_STRING;
159
160    /**
161     *  The attribute name for an XML attribute holding a class name: {@value}.
162     */
163    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
164    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Class = "class";
165
166    /**
167     *  The attribute name for the XML id attribute: {@value}.
168     */
169    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
170    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Id = "xml:id";
171
172    /**
173     *  <p>{@summary The attribute name for the XML language attribute:
174     *  {@value}.}</p>
175     *  <p>This reserved attribute takes an ISO639 language identifier as
176     *  value. It indicates the language of the body of the element.</p>
177     */
178    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
179    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Language = "xml:lang";
180
181    /**
182     *  The attribute name for the XML space attribute: {@value}.<br>
183     *  This reserved attribute indicates whether any whitespace inside the
184     *  element is significant and should not be altered by the XML processor.
185     *  The attribute can take one of two enumerated values:
186     *  <dl>
187     *      <dt>{@code preserve}</dt>
188     *          <dd>The XML application preserves all whitespace (newlines,
189     *          spaces, and tabs) present within the element.</dd>
190     *      <dt>{@code default}</dt>
191     *          <dd>The XML processor uses its default processing rules when
192     *          deciding to preserve or discard the whitespace inside the
193     *          element.</dd>
194     *  </dl>
195     */
196    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
197    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Whitespace = "xml:space";
198
199    /**
200     *  The element name for an XML element holding text: {@value}.
201     */
202    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
203    public static final String XMLELEMENT_Text = "text";
204
205        /*------------*\
206    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
207        \*------------*/
208
209        /*------------------------*\
210    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
211        \*------------------------*/
212    /**
213     *  The empty string.
214     */
215    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
216    public static final String EMPTY_STRING;
217
218    /**
219     *  The null character.
220     */
221    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
222    public static final char NULL_CHAR;
223
224    static
225    {
226        EMPTY_STRING = "";
227        NULL_CHAR = '\u0000';
228        NULL_STRING = String.valueOf( (Object) null ).intern();
229    }
230
231        /*--------------*\
232    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
233        \*--------------*/
234    /**
235     *  No instance allowed for this class.
236     */
237    private ToolKit() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( ToolKit.class ); }
238
239        /*---------*\
240    ====** Methods **==========================================================
241        \*---------*/
242    /**
243     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the non-ASCII and special characters in a
244     *  {@code String} so that the result can be used in the context of HTML.}
245     *  Wherever possible, the method will return the respective HTML&nbsp;5
246     *  entity; only when there is no matching entity, it will use the Unicode
247     *  escape.</p>
248     *
249     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
250     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
251     *      argument was already {@code null}.
252     *
253     *  @since 0.0.5
254     */
255    /*
256     *  For some unknown reasons, JavaDoc will not accept the entities &#x7403;
257     *  and &#x4F53; (for '球' and '体'), therefore it was required to add the
258     *  Chinese character directly into the comment above.
259     */
260    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
261    public static final String escapeHTML( final CharSequence str )
262    {
263        final var retValue = nonNull( str ) ? HTML50.escape( str ) : null;
264
265        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
266        return retValue;
267    }   //  escapeHTML()
268
269    /**
270     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using HTML entities and
271     *  writes them to an
272     *  {@link Appendable}.
273     *  For details, refer to
274     *  {@link #escapeHTML(CharSequence)}.
275     *
276     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
277     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
278     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
279     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
280     *      from calls to the
281     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
282     *      method.
283     *  @since 0.0.5
284     */
285    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
286    public static final void escapeHTML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
287    {
288        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
289
290        if( nonNull( str ) ) HTML50.escape( appendable, str );
291    }   //  escapeHTML()
292
293    /**
294     *  Tests if the given String is {@code null} or the empty String.
295     *
296     *  @param  s   The String to test.
297     *  @return {@code true} if the given String reference is
298     *      {@code null} or the empty String.
299     *
300     *  @since 0.0.5
301     */
302    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
303    public static final boolean isEmpty( final CharSequence s ) { return isNull( s ) || s.isEmpty(); }
304
305    /**
306     *  Tests if the given String is {@code null}, the empty String, or just
307     *  containing whitespace.
308     *
309     *  @param  s   The String to test.
310     *  @return {@code true} if the given String reference is not
311     *      {@code null} and not the empty String.
312     *
313     *  @see String#isBlank()
314     *
315     *  @since 0.0.5
316     */
317    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
318    public static final boolean isEmptyOrBlank( final CharSequence s )
319    {
320        final var retValue = isNull( s ) || s.toString().isBlank();
321
322        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
323        return retValue;
324    }   //  isEmptyOrBlank()
325
326    /**
327     *  Tests if the given String is not {@code null} and not the empty
328     *  String.
329     *
330     *  @param  s   The String to test.
331     *  @return {@code true} if the given String reference is not
332     *      {@code null} and not the empty String.
333     *
334     *  @since 0.0.5
335     */
336    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
337    public static final boolean isNotEmpty( final CharSequence s ) { return nonNull( s ) && !s.isEmpty(); }
338
339    /**
340     *  Tests if the given String is not {@code null}, not the empty String,
341     *  and that it contains other characters than just whitespace.
342     *
343     *  @param  s   The String to test.
344     *  @return {@code true} if the given String reference is not
345     *      {@code null} and not the empty String, and it contains other
346     *      characters than just whitespace.
347     *
348     *  @see String#isBlank()
349     *
350     *  @since 0.0.5
351     */
352    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
353    public static final boolean isNotEmptyOrBlank( final CharSequence s )
354    {
355        final var retValue = nonNull( s ) && !s.toString().isBlank();
356
357        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
358        return retValue;
359    }   //  isNotEmptyOrBlank()
360
361    /**
362     *  Sometimes a special sort order is required that cannot be defined as a
363     *  rule. Instead, a list defines the sequence. This method creates a new
364     *  {@link Comparator}
365     *  instance that works on the given list of keys. Values that are not on
366     *  that list will be placed to the end, ordered according to their natural
367     *  order if they or their keys implement the
368     *  {@link Comparable}
369     *  interface, or without any specific order.
370     *
371     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
372     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
373     *      be the same as the type itself.
374     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
375     *  @return The comparator.
376     */
377    @SafeVarargs
378    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
379    public static final <T,K> Comparator<T> listBasedComparator( final K... keys ) { return new ListBasedComparator<>( keys ); }
380
381    /**
382     *  Sometimes a special sort order is required that cannot be defined as a
383     *  rule. Instead, a list defines the sequence. This method creates a new
384     *  {@link Comparator}
385     *  instance that works on the given list of keys. Values that are not on
386     *  that list will be placed to the end, ordered according to their natural
387     *  order if they or their keys implement the
388     *  {@link Comparable}
389     *  interface, or without any specific order.
390     *
391     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
392     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
393     *      be the same as the type itself.
394     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
395     *  @return The comparator.
396     */
397    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
398    public static final <T,K> Comparator<T> listBasedComparator( final List<K> keys ) { return new ListBasedComparator<>( keys ); }
399
400    /**
401     *  Sometimes a special sort order is required that cannot be defined as a
402     *  rule. Instead, a list defines the sequence. This method creates a new
403     *  {@link Comparator}
404     *  instance that works on the given list of keys.
405     *
406     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
407     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
408     *      be the same as the type itself.
409     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
410     *      {@link KeyProvider}
411     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
412     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
413     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
414     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
415     *      {@link Comparable}
416     *      interface.
417     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
418     *  @return The comparator.
419     */
420    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
421    public static final <T,K> Comparator<T> listBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final List<K> keys )
422    {
423        return new ListBasedComparator<>( keyProvider, comparator, keys );
424    }   //  listBasedComparator()
425
426    /**
427     *  Sometimes a special sort order is required that cannot be defined as a
428     *  rule. Instead, a list defines the sequence. This method creates a new
429     *  {@link Comparator}
430     *  instance that works on the given list of keys.
431     *
432     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
433     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
434     *      be the same as the type itself.
435     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
436     *      {@link KeyProvider}
437     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
438     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
439     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
440     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
441     *      {@link Comparable}
442     *      interface.
443     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
444     *  @return The comparator.
445     */
446    @SafeVarargs
447    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
448    public static final <T,K> Comparator<T> listBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T, ? super K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final K... keys )
449    {
450        return new ListBasedComparator<>( keyProvider, comparator, keys );
451    }   //  listBasedComparator()
452
453    /**
454     *  <p>{@summary Reads the complete content of the provided
455     *  {@link Reader }
456     *  into a
457     *  {@link String}.}</p>
458     *  <p>Obviously this method is feasible only for files with a limited
459     *  size.</p>
460     *
461     *  @param  reader  The {@code Reader} instance.
462     *  @return The content of the provided {@code Reader}.
463     *  @throws IOException Problems on reading from the {@code Reader}.
464     */
465    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
466    public static final String loadToString( final Reader reader ) throws IOException
467    {
468        final var builder = new StringBuilder( DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE );
469        final var buffer = new char [DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE];
470        var bytesRead = requireNonNullArgument( reader, "reader" ).read( buffer );
471        while( bytesRead > 0 )
472        {
473            builder.append( buffer, 0, bytesRead );
474            bytesRead = reader.read( buffer );
475        }
476        final var retValue = builder.toString();
477
478        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
479        return retValue;
480    }   //  loadToString()
481
482    /**
483     *  Determines the maximum length over all Strings provided in the given
484     *  {@link Stream}.
485     *
486     *  @param  stream  The strings.
487     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
488     *      in the given {@code stream} are {@code null}, and
489     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
490     *      if the given {@code stream} is empty.
491     *
492     *  @since 0.0.5
493     */
494    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
495    public static final int maxContentLength( final Stream<? extends CharSequence> stream )
496    {
497        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( stream, "stream" )
498            .mapToInt( s -> nonNull( s ) ? s.length() : -1 )
499            .max()
500            .orElse( Integer.MIN_VALUE );
501
502        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
503        return retValue;
504    }   //  maxContentLength()
505
506    /**
507     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
508     *  {@link Collection}.
509     *
510     *  @param  list    The strings.
511     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
512     *      in the given {@code list} are {@code null}, and
513     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
514     *      if the given {@code list} is empty.
515     *
516     *  @since 0.0.5
517     */
518    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
519    public static final int maxContentLength( final Collection<? extends CharSequence> list )
520    {
521        final var retValue = maxContentLength( requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ).stream() );
522
523        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
524        return retValue;
525    }   //  maxContentLength()
526
527    /**
528     *  Checks if the given argument {@code a} is {@code null} and throws a
529     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
530     *  if it is {@code null}.
531     *
532     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
533     *  @param  a   The argument to check.
534     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
535     *      message.
536     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}.
537     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code a} is {@code null}.
538     */
539    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
540    public static final <T> T requireNonNullArgument( final T a, final String name )
541    {
542        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
543        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
544        if( isNull( a ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
545
546        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
547        return a;
548    }   //  requireNonNullArgument()
549
550    /**
551     *  Checks if the given argument {@code a} is {@code null} or empty and
552     *  throws a
553     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
554     *  if it is {@code null}, or a
555     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
556     *  if it is empty.<br>
557     *  <br>Strings, arrays,
558     *  {@link java.util.Collection}s, and
559     *  {@link java.util.Map}s
560     *  will be checked on being empty; this includes instances of
561     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuilder},
562     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuffer},
563     *  and
564     *  {@link java.lang.CharSequence}.<br>
565     *  <br>For an instance of
566     *  {@link java.util.Optional},
567     *  the presence of a value is checked in order to determine whether it is
568     *  empty or not.<br>
569     *  <br>Because the interface
570     *  {@link java.util.Enumeration}
571     *  does not provide an API for the check on emptiness
572     *  ({@link java.util.Enumeration#hasMoreElements() hasMoreElements()}
573     *  will return {@code false} after all elements have been taken from
574     *  the {@code Enumeration} instance), the result for arguments of this
575     *  type has to be taken with caution.<br>
576     *  <br>For instances of
577     *  {@link java.util.stream.Stream},
578     *  this method will only check for {@code null} (like
579     *  {@link #requireNonNullArgument(Object,String)}.
580     *  This is because any operation on the stream would render it unusable
581     *  for later processing.<br>
582     *  <br>In case the argument is of type
583     *  {@link Optional},
584     *  this method behaves different from
585     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String)};
586     *  this one will return the {@code Optional} instance, while the other
587     *  method will return its contents.
588     *
589     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
590     *  @param  a   The argument to check; may be {@code null}.
591     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
592     *      message.
593     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}.
594     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code a} is {@code null}.
595     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code a} is empty.
596     */
597    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
598    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( final T a, final String name )
599    {
600        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
601        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
602
603        //---* Check for null *------------------------------------------------
604        if( isNull( a ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
605
606        //---* Check the type *------------------------------------------------
607        //noinspection IfStatementWithTooManyBranches
608        if( a instanceof CharSequence charSequence )
609        {
610            if( charSequence.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
611        }
612        else if( a.getClass().isArray() )
613        {
614            if( Array.getLength( a ) == 0 ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
615        }
616        else if( a instanceof Collection<?> collection )
617            {
618                if( collection.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
619            }
620            else if( a instanceof Map<?,?> )
621                {
622                    if( ((Map<?,?>) a).isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
623                }
624                else if( a instanceof Enumeration<?> )
625                    {
626                        /*
627                         * The funny thing with an Enumeration is that it could have been
628                         * not empty in the beginning, but it may be empty (= having no
629                         * more elements) now.
630                         * The good thing is that Enumeration.hasMoreElements() will not
631                         * change the state of the Enumeration - at least it should not do
632                         * so.
633                         */
634                        if( !((Enumeration<?>) a).hasMoreElements() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
635                    }
636                    else //noinspection StatementWithEmptyBody
637                        if( a instanceof Optional<?> optional)
638                        {
639                            /*
640                             * This is different from the behaviour of
641                             * requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String) as the Optional will be
642                             * returned here.
643                             */
644                            if( optional.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
645                        }
646                        else
647                        {
648                            /*
649                             * Other data types are not further processed; in particular,
650                             * instances of Stream cannot be checked on being empty. This is
651                             * because any operation on the Stream itself will change its state
652                             * and may make the Stream unusable.
653                             */
654                        }
655
656        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
657        return a;
658    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
659
660    /**
661     *  Checks if the given argument {@code a} of type
662     *  {@link Optional}
663     *  is {@code null} or empty and
664     *  throws a
665     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
666     *  if it is {@code null}, or a
667     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
668     *  if it is empty.<br>
669     *  <br>Otherwise it returns the value of the {@code Optional}.<br>
670     *  <br>This is different from the behaviour of
671     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Object,String)}
672     *  with an instance of {@code Optional} as the argument to test.
673     *
674     *  @param  <T> The type of the given {@code Optional} to check.
675     *  @param  optional    The argument to check; can be {@code null}.
676     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
677     *      message.
678     *  @return The value of the argument if {@code optional} is not
679     *      {@code null}.
680     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code optional} is {@code null}.
681     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code optional} is empty.
682     */
683    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
684    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType" ) final Optional<T> optional, final String name )
685    {
686        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
687        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
688
689        //---* Check for null *------------------------------------------------
690        if( isNull( optional ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
691        final var retValue = optional.orElseThrow( () -> new EmptyArgumentException( name ) );
692
693        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
694        return retValue;
695    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
696
697    /**
698     *  Splits a String by the given separator character and returns an array
699     *  of all parts. In case a separator character is immediately followed by
700     *  another separator char, an empty String will be place to the array.
701     *  Beginning and end of the String are treated as separators, so if the
702     *  first character of the String is a separator, the returned array will
703     *  start with an empty string, as it will end with an empty String if the
704     *  last character is a separator.<br>
705     *  <br>In case the String is empty, the return value will be an array
706     *  containing just the empty String.
707     *
708     *  @param  string  The String to split.
709     *  @param  separator   The separator character.
710     *  @return The parts of the String.
711     *
712     *  @since 0.0.5
713     */
714    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
715    public static final String [] splitString( final CharSequence string, final char separator )
716    {
717        return splitString( string, (int) separator );
718    }   //  splitString()
719
720    /**
721     *  Splits a String by the given separator character, identified by its
722     *  Unicode code point, and returns an array of all parts. In case a
723     *  separator character is immediately followed by another separator char,
724     *  an empty String will be placed to the array. Beginning and end of the
725     *  String are treated as separators, so if the first character of the
726     *  String is a separator, the returned array will start with an empty
727     *  String, as it will end with an empty String if the last character is a
728     *  separator.<br>
729     *  <br>In case the String is empty, the return value will be an array
730     *  containing just the empty String.
731     *
732     *  @param  string  The String to split.
733     *  @param  separator   The code point for the separator character.
734     *  @return The parts of the String.
735     *
736     *  @since 0.0.5
737     */
738    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
739    public static final String [] splitString( final CharSequence string, final int separator )
740    {
741        final var retValue = stream( string, separator ).toArray( String []::new );
742
743        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
744        return retValue;
745    }   //  splitString()
746
747    /**
748     *  <p>{@summary Splits a String by the given separator character, identified by its
749     *  Unicode code point, and returns a
750     *  {@link Stream}
751     *  of all parts.} In case a separator character is immediately followed by
752     *  another separator char, an empty String will be put to the
753     *  {@code Stream}. Beginning and end of the String are treated as
754     *  separators, so if the first character of the String is a separator, the
755     *  returned {@code Stream} will start with an empty String, as it will end
756     *  with an empty String if the last character is a separator.</p>
757     *  <p>In case the String is empty, the return value will be a
758     *  {@code Stream} containing just the empty String.</p>
759     *
760     *  @param  string  The String to split.
761     *  @param  separator   The code point for the separator character.
762     *  @return A {@code Stream} instance with the parts of the String.
763     *
764     *  @since 0.0.7
765     */
766    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.7" )
767    public static final Stream<String> stream( final CharSequence string, final int separator )
768    {
769        //---* Process the string *--------------------------------------------
770        final var s = requireNonNullArgument( string, "string" ).codePoints().toArray();
771        final var builder = Stream.<String>builder();
772        var begin = -1;
773        for( var i = 0 ; i < s.length; ++i )
774        {
775            if( begin == -1 )
776            {
777                begin = i;
778            }
779            if( s [ i ] == separator )
780            {
781                builder.add( new String( s, begin, i - begin ).intern() );
782                begin = -1;
783            }
784        }
785
786        //---* Add the rest *--------------------------------------------------
787        //noinspection ConstantConditions
788        if( (begin >= 0) && (begin < s.length) )
789        {
790            builder.add( new String( s, begin, s.length - begin ).intern() );
791        }
792        if( (s.length == 0) || (s [s.length - 1] == separator) )
793        {
794            builder.add( EMPTY_STRING );
795        }
796
797        //---* Create the return value *---------------------------------------
798        final var retValue = builder.build();
799
800        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
801        return retValue;
802    }   //  stream()
803}
804//  class ToolKit
805
806/*
807 *  End of File
808 */
